FuncDef:
The access-limit adjustment system-state enable command is used to deny BAS new user access when memory usage of interface broad or main control broad is 90%.
The undo access-limit adjustment system-state disable command is used to deny BAS new user access when memory usage of interface broad or main control broad is 90%.
The access-limit adjustment system-state disable command is used to allow BAS new user access when memory usage of interface broad or main control broad is 90%.
By default, deny BAS new user access when memory usage of interface broad or main control broad is 90%.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
access-limit adjustment system-state enable and undo access-limit adjustment system-state disable commands are used to deny BAS new user access when memory usage of interface broad or main control broad is 90%.
It is not recommended that you disable this function.
Configuration Impact
User type is new access BAS user(IPoe, PPPoE, Special user) and new access L2TP tunnel user.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
